discussion.author: fredrikekre
discussion.text:
Please add (at least)
```
[compat]
julia = "1"
```
to your project file and retrigger the bot.

discussion.author: fredrikekre
discussion.text: Just to make sure, did you intend to disallow Julia 1.0?

discussion.author: floswald
discussion.text: i have been using 1.1 so that's why i set it there. travis runs on 1.0. so i guess it would be better to use 1.0. sorry about that, i'll change again!

discussion.author: floswald
discussion.text: travis died on the previous build no idea why. restarted now.

discussion.author: floswald
discussion.text: phew... i had removed a `__precompile__(false)` without knowing too much about it. all hell broke loose! i think we're ready to go now.

discussion.author: fredrikekre
discussion.text:
> phew... i had removed a __precompile__(false) without knowing too much about it. all hell broke loose! i think we're ready to go now.

What happened? Unless you do weird things it should be fine to precompile. maybe you just need to initialize these https://github.com/floswald/SMM.jl/blob/86923918ebc55103a51ce446427130079375bae2/src/SMM.jl#L79-L80 in the `__init__()`?

(Btw, its a bit weird that your package swaps out the users logger.)

discussion.author: floswald
discussion.text:
Oh. That’s a couple of things I don’t fully understand I have to admit.
Sorry for all that. I noticed the logger actually doesn’t even work for me
(like setting debut level didn’t change anything). How to do this
properly?  Should I not specify a logger at all?

discussion.author: fredrikekre
discussion.text:
> Should I not specify a logger at all?

IMO a package should not set the global logger, for example, if in my code I have
```
my_logger = ...
using SMM
???
```
loading your package changes my own set logger. So I think setting loggers is only for top level applications, not for packages. See https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/pull/28229 for some more discussion.

discussion.author: floswald
discussion.text:
I see that makes sense. Only have experience with publishing R packages
where logging is left totally to packages. But that was bad extrapolation,
sorry. Let me remove that and submit again!
